request.description:
First request is API status check request that confirms us is baseURL available so we can use it for further API testing. Base URL is set as a variable.

As a response we'll get HTML of requsted website with all of it's contents.

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

request.description:
This request is sent in order to generate authentication token that we'll use in further API testing of this application.

This request requires authentication with valid parameters email and password in order for API Token to be created.

baseURL endpoint is /api/v2/sessions

Valid email, password and baseURL are set in variables of PlaceLab environment.

Expected response of this request is generated API Token in JSON format.

Actual response of this request is generated API Token in JSON format.

Generated API Token is also set as variable in PlaceLab environment for further use as "accessToken".

Test case: Login test with random email and password

This request is sent in order to check login functionality providing random email and password.

For this purpose we used $random variables from Postman for email and password.

baseURL endpoint is /api/v2/sessions

Expected response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Actual response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Test case: Login test with random email and valid password

This request is sent in order to check login functionality providing random email and valid password.

For this purpose we used $random variables from Postman for email and valid password.

baseURL endpoint is /api/v2/sessions

Expected response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Actual response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Test case: Login test with valid email and random password

This request is sent in order to check login functionality providing valid email and random password.

For this purpose we used $random variables from Postman for password and valid email.

baseURL endpoint is /api/v2/sessions

Expected response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Actual response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Test case: Login test with empty credentials for email and password.

This request is sent in order to check login functionality providing empty credentials for email and password.

baseURL endpoint is /api/v2/sessions

Expected response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.

Actual response: 401 Unauthorized, error: "Password mismatch" in JSON format.
